content:
Diagnosis:		Chromophobe renal cell carcinoma

Management:		Right radical nephrectomy 15 March 2023

Histology:		pT2b (9.5cm) N0, CD117 positive chromophobe renal cell carcinoma, margins clear

Current situation:	Routine surveillance review

[redacted name] attended for routine follow-up today. She remains well with no concerning symptoms. Her surgical scars are well-healed and she has returned to her normal activities. Recent CT chest/abdomen/pelvis from 12/4/24 shows no evidence of recurrence or metastatic disease. Blood tests including renal function are satisfactory. She will continue on our standard surveillance protocol with next imaging in 6 months' time. We will review her again following those scans. She understands to contact us sooner if she develops any new symptoms of concern.

primary_cancer.histopathology_status: chromophobe renal cell carcinoma, 9.5cm tumor, margins clear

cancer_timeline.value: CT chest/abdomen/pelvis shows no evidence of recurrence or metastatic disease

patient_facts.value: Blood tests including renal function satisfactory

status_updates.value: Post-nephrectomy for localized chromophobe renal cell carcinoma. No evidence of recurrence on surveillance imaging.
